meanings.definition: The act or process of adding things together to get a total.
meanings.sent1: In math class, we learned that a summation is when you add all the numbers together.
meanings.sent3: The summation of all the ingredients in the recipe made a delicious cake.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the summation of all the happiness in the room.
meanings.sent5: The summation of the colors in the painting created a beautiful masterpiece.

meanings.definition: The total amount resulting from the addition of numbers or quantities.
meanings.sent1: The summation of the apples and oranges was 10 fruits in total.
meanings.sent2: After the summation of all the scores, the team won the game.
meanings.sent3: The summation of the coins in his pocket made him feel rich.
meanings.sent4: The summation of their efforts led to a successful project completion.
meanings.sent5: The summation of the puzzle pieces revealed a stunning picture.

meanings.definition: A summary or concise statement of a larger idea or concept.
meanings.sent1: The teacher asked for a summation of the story we read.
meanings.sent2: The summation of the meeting highlighted the key points discussed.
meanings.sent3: His speech was a summation of all the hard work put into the project.
meanings.sent4: The painting was a beautiful summation of the artist's emotions.
meanings.sent5: The summation of the book left the readers feeling satisfied.
